II.iii.2.A.1.a
.
Communication of an ITF
The Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) stopped accepting informal claims on March 24, 2015.  Claimants desiring the benefit of filing an informal claim (as expressed in
M21-1, Part II, Subpart iii, 2.H
) must now communicate to VA an “intent to file” a claim.  They may accomplish this by
submitting a completed
VA Form 21-0966, Intent to File a Claim for Compensation and/or Pension, or Survivors Pension and/or DIC
contacting a national call center at 1-800-827-1000
initiating
an application for benefits via a VA claims submission service website, or
contacting a Veterans Service Center (VSC)/pension management center (PMC) employee by telephone or in person.
Note
:  If a claimant expresses an intent to file (ITF)
before
March 24, 2015, determine whether VA may accept the communication as an informal claim.
References
:  For more information on
informal claims, see
M21-1, Part II, Subpart iii, 2.H
, and
VA claims submission service websites, see
M21-1, Part II, Subpart iii, 4.A
and
B
.
